text: Flying
flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
originalText: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
originalText: Draw three cards. You lose 3 life.
flavor: Knowledge demands sacrifice.

originalText:
Flying

Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

text: Flying, vigilance
originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

text: Vigilance
flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.
originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.

Armageddon
text: Destroy all lands.
originalText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)

name: Barbtooth Wurm
flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

name: Bargain
text:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
originalText:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
flavor: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

name: Blinding Light

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
originalText: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
originalText: Flying
name: Bog Imp

text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.
originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a swamp in play.)
name: Bog Raiders

text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a swamp in play.)
name: Bog Wraith
Border Guard
flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
originalText: Put target creature card from your graveyard into play.

text: Islandwalk
flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has an island in play.)
name: Bull Hippo

text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.
originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
name: Champion Lancer

text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.
originalText: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
name: Charging Paladin
Chorus of Woe
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

name: Cinder Storm
text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

name: Coral Eel
flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

name: Counterspell
text: Counter target spell.
originalText: Counter target spell.

text: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"
originalText: When Dakmor Ghoul comes into play, target opponent loses 2 life. You gain 2 life.
name: Dakmor Ghoul

text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.
originalText: When Dakmor Lancer comes into play, destroy target nonblack creature.
name: Dakmor Lancer
Dakmor Plague
text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

name: Dakmor Scorpion
flavor: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

name: Dakmor Sorceress
text: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
originalText: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of swamps you control. (Count only the swamps you have in play, including both tapped and untapped swamps.)

name: Dark Offering
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
flavor:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor

text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
originalText: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play, return all other creatures you control from play to their owner's hand.
name: Denizen of the Deep
Devastation
text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
originalText: Destroy all creatures and all lands. (This includes your creatures and lands.)
flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

name: Devoted Hero
flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

text: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Discipline wears many robes.
originalText: When Devout Monk comes into play, you gain 1 life.
name: Devout Monk

Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
originalText:
Flying
When Dread Reaper comes into play, you lose 5 life.

name: Durkwood Boars
flavor: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ." —The Bible, Mark 5:13

name: Eager Cadet
flavor: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

name: Earth Elemental
flavor: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

name: Exhaustion

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
originalText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

name: Extinguish
text: Counter target sorcery spell.
originalText: Counter target sorcery spell.

name: Eye Spy
text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into his or her graveyard.
originalText: Look at the top card of target player's library. Put that card back on top of that library or into that player's graveyard.

name: False Peace
text: Target player skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
originalText: Target player can't attack on his or her next turn.
flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.

text: Flying
flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.
originalText: Flying
name: Feral Shadow
Fire Elemental
flavor: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

name: Fire Tempest
text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

name: Foot Soldiers
flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

originalText: For each card in your hand, you gain 2 life. (Don't count this card.)
flavor: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."

name: Giant Octopus
flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

name: Goblin Cavaliers
flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
flavor: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.
originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes into play.)
name: Goblin Chariot

text: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
flavor: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.
originalText: When Goblin Commando comes into play, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
flavor: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."
originalText:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
name: Goblin Glider
Goblin Hero
flavor: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

name: Goblin Lore
text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
originalText: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random from your hand.
flavor:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."

text: Mountainwalk
flavor: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.
originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a mountain in play.)
name: Goblin Mountaineer

text: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
flavor: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.
originalText: When Goblin Settler comes into play, destroy target land.
name: Goblin Settler
Gorilla Warrior
flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

name: Grim Tutor
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library. You lose 3 life.
originalText: Search your library for any card and put that card into your hand. You lose 3 life.
flavor:
He who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

name: Hand of Death
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The touch of death is never gentle.

text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.
originalText: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

name: Howling Fury
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
originalText: Hulking Goblin can't block.

name: Knight Errant
flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

name: Last Chance
text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
originalText: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn. (You won't lose if you've won before the end of that turn.)

name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target opponent.
flavor: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
originalText: Lone Wolf may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
name: Lone Wolf

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.
originalText: When Loyal Sentry blocks, destroy it and the creature it blocks. (Destroy both creatures before dealing damage.)
name: Loyal Sentry

text: Forestwalk
flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.
originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)
name: Lynx

text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.
originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to its owner's hand.
name: Man-o'-War

rulings.text: It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.
originalText: Target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If that player has only one card, he or she discards it.)

name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
flavor: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

flavor:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

name: Natural Spring
text: Target player gains 8 life.
originalText: You gain 8 life.
flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

name: Nature's Cloak
text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn.
originalText: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They're unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)

name: Nature's Lore

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"‘Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout
originalText: Norwood Archers can block as though it had flying.
name: Norwood Archers
Norwood Ranger

foreignNames.name: ノーウッドのレインジャー

flavor: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

name: Ogre Warrior
flavor: Assault and battery included.

Flying

originalText:
Flying

rulings.text: If the spell fails because the target is not there or isn't legal, the owner does not gain any life.

text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
originalText: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
flavor:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

originalText: This turn, you may tap lands you don't control to help pay for your spells.
flavor: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.

name: Pride of Lions

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

name: Psychic Transfer

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
originalText: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes into play.)
name: Raging Goblin
Raise Dead

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

name: Ransack
text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.
originalText: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play, target player chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.
name: Ravenous Rats
Relearn
text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

name: Relentless Assault

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You get another combat phase, followed by another main phase, this turn.

name: Remove Soul

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

text: Counter target creature spell.
originalText: Counter target creature spell.
flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

name: Renewing Touch
text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
originalText: Shuffle any number of creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
flavor: Death just encourages life the more.

name: Righteous Charge

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
originalText: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

name: Righteous Fury
text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you gain 2 life.

text: Flying
flavor: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.
originalText: Flying

text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra
originalText: When Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
name: Royal Trooper
Sacred Nectar
text: You gain 4 life.
originalText: You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

text: Flying
flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

flavor: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
originalText: Target player loses 4 life. You gain 4 life.
flavor: Evil often dines alone.

name: Southern Elephant
flavor: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

name: Spitting Earth
text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
originalText: Spitting Earth deals to target creature damage equal to the number of mountains you control. (Count only the mountains you have in play, including both tapped and untapped mountains.)

name: Squall
text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
originalText: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

name: Steadfastness
text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy target land.

Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.

name: Summer Bloom

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
originalText: Put up to three land cards from your hand into play.
flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
originalText: When Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. Sylvan Basilisk still doesn't deal damage to defending player.)
name: Sylvan Basilisk

text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.
originalText: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
name: Sylvan Yeti

text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
originalText: You may have Thorn Elemental deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
name: Thorn Elemental

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

text:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.
originalText:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon comes into play, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures.)
name: Thunder Dragon
Tidings
text: Draw four cards.
originalText: Draw four cards.
flavor:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

name: Time Warp

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
originalText: Target player takes another turn after this one.
flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: Draw two cards.
originalText: Draw two cards.
flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

name: Trained Orgg
flavor: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

name: Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

name: Undo

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
originalText: Return two target creatures to their owner's hand. (You can't play this card unless you can choose two creatures in play.)

name: Untamed Wilds

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, you gain 2 life.
